description: At Greenly, we are on a mission to lead the way in carbon reduction and sustainability. description_entreprise: Founded in 2019 by Alexis, Matthieu and Arnaud, Greenlyâ€™s mission is to allow everyone to easily track their carbon footprint, so they can take part in the fight against climate change. Greenly combines tech and carbon accounting, making carbon calculations automatic for SMEs and individuals by syncing their financial data. This lets them focus on what really matters: reducing their GHG emissions with better insights and lower costs; adopting more sustainable spending patterns, and engaging their ecosystem to navigate the energy transition. Fintech of the year 2020, French Tech Green20 & French Tech 2030, 2022 LinkedIn Top Startups, Hottest start-up in Paris by WIRED, Greenly is now the leading carbon tracking technology. Since its foundation, more than 10 million people and +1600 companies have trusted Greenly with their carbon footprint report. Fundraising: $23M

description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst intern to strengthen the R&D department focused on three challenges: Internal Optimization Empower all teams by providing them with clear, reliable, and comprehensive data. Enhance the impact of our sales team by implementing lead scoring to predict which salesperson should handle which lead. Proactively engage with the Customer Success Management (CSM) team by identifying early indicators that may lead to potential customer loss. Gain a deeper understanding of how our customers use our products, including process mining, with the broader goal of personalizing/simplifying the platform based on user profiles. Product Work Conduct statistical analyses of the purchasing behaviors of our end customers to assist them in better understanding their user base. Create a feature based on predicting the cancellation rates of athletes for their classes, allowing them to anticipate with theoretical overbooking. Develop a feature based on predicting the final fill rates of classes to suggest dynamic pricing to studios. Strategic Management Define and implement metrics at different levels, either globally or by team.
 The bsport data stack comprises a datalake consolidating all available data, a functional data pipeline (Airflow) on AWS infrastructure, and well-integrated visualization tools like Metabase for optimal project launches. The role, directly supervised by the Lead Data, collaborates with various team managers, including the CDO, Head of Sales, Head of CSM, and future COO. Compensation ranges from â‚¬1100 to â‚¬2000 monthly, depending on the profile.

description: About Stockly Stockly is a retail-tech company that targets to solve the problem of out-of-stock products in e-commerce. With our technology, e-retailers can keep selling out-of-stock products, making other retailers ship them directly to consumers. Our product is live across Europe and convinces more clients every day. Our mission is to create the world first global inventory for retail. To better understand what we do, check out  our French pitch at BFMTV , or  our English pitch at Techstars . We are looking for a smart and talented Data Analyst Intern to join the BI team working closely with our CTO  Oscar , our Head of Network  Pierre , our Financial Officer  Etienne  and our Business Developers (e.g.  Matthieu  &  Yann) . The BI is currently composed of  Maria  and  Anouar . You can apply even if it is to start in 6 months! Position [This is not a Data â€œScientistâ€ position, there are no Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence components for now] To tackle our cross team challenges, you are a candidate willing to actively participate to the company development. In our growing team, everyone is key including you as you will be working on the frontier of several domains: Develop and maintain SQL dashboards, to monitor data and analyse performance Extract and interpret data for business requirements Train colleagues on data extraction & interpretation Identify new features to make our product evolve according to usage and needs Everytime you will face recurring tasks or pain points, you will be in charge of finding and implementing solution to tackle this and help the company and team move to next stage. Challenges Tackling an international market in a fast growing startup, youâ€™ll have three main challenges: â€¢  Complexity : a lot can happen in an e-commerce transaction, specially when you connect multiple players. â€¢  Performance : Stockly manages tens of millions of articles, thatâ€™s a hell of a lot of web requests per day. â€¢  Scalability : Being focus on growth, we require that published code still work with ten times more volume. ğŸ’ About your future benefits Competitive packages : for this position, package range is typically  1500-2000â‚¬  depending on the profile (e.g. basic knowledge to expert). We have a well defined and objective salary grid that is based on both  skills level  and  scarcity of profiles  ğŸ’¸ Meal vouchers  by Swile ğŸ½ï¸ 50%  reimbursement of your  Navigo Pass  ğŸš‹ A central and amazing  working environment  in  le Sentier  (Paris) ğŸ’¼ Flexible and  remote-friendly policy  ğŸ¡ Possibility to take a  few paid days-off  to be discussed with Team Leader ğŸ„ Stockly dinners  together every other Thursday ğŸ» Stockly breakfasts together  every other Friday ğŸ¥ Coffee, tea and fruits  available everyday ğŸ‡ Climbing, football & more  teams ğŸ§— If your internship goes well for both you and Stockly, why not join us?  We are growing fast, there is space for every amazing people! âš™ï¸ About how we work Every team has a  daily meeting  to align on priorities and solve issues â‡’  You wonâ€™t be left alone! Every Monday we have a global  weekly meeting  where every team shares what they are working on and what they will do for the coming week â‡’  You will have visibility on the whole company! Every quarter we have our  OKR meeting  ( Objectives, Key Results)  where each team shows the results of the previous quarter and the objectives of the following one â‡’  You will see the company grow and your own role inside of it! During all these meetings  everyone can challenge  each other and all questions are more than welcome â‡’  Transparency is one of our key values, and we are always open to new ideas!

With our technology,  we connect in real-time e-commerce websites  in need for stock  with the inventory of hundreds of other retailers  who have the same products available, and who can fulfill the order on their behalf. E-retailers can  sell products they donâ€™t own , while others can gain additional sales, in a  seamless experience for the end-consumer . ğŸ† Our mission is to create the  worldâ€™s 1st globally shared inventory  for retail. description: Context on the Data Integration Data is a cornerstone for Seyna. Data will allow us to differentiate ourselves from our competition and it will help us protect the future of our insurance company. This can only become true if our data is of high quality, and efficiently processed. We exchange with more partners daily: we receive data from the brokers and distributors that sell our products, then analyze and process it, before sharing our results and insights with our ecosystem. Exchanging data with our partners presents an increasing challenge as our business grows : increasing volume, data diversity, and increasingly diverse sources. The Data Integration Manager makes sure exchanging data with Seyna is as easy for our partners, while still meeting our internal requirements. She also owns the quality of the data - checking that the data we received is correct. Your Missions: As a Data Integration Manager you will : Help our partners with their data integration process (onboarding and run) Design custom APIs on a day-to-day basis, for each new partner integrating with Seyna Work with our Data Engineer to make the integration as easy as possible. Collect the partnerâ€™s data. If not fully automated, you integrate it yourself into Seynaâ€™s ecosystem. Check data consistency regarding accounting & business rules (e.g. premium acquisition rate vs receipt emission, reinsurance cession rate, written premium vs receipt emissionâ€¦) Automate the data quality process and make it more efficient Assist the team with the data monitoring and data analysis Shape the future of data integration at Seyna ! Our Current Stack Data integration Deployed on AWS with AWS CDK (IaC) Coded in Python

Seyna already empowers insurance brokers to grow their business. It provides a platform which combines tailor-made insurance products and advanced SaaS (Software as a Service). By building their business on Seynaâ€™s platform, brokers can create unique and personalized insurance experiences, from underwriting to claims handling. The platform automates administrative and compliance tasks, freeing up brokersâ€™ time to spend with policyholders. Seynaâ€™s goal is to shift the â‚¬560Bn EU P&C market onto Seynaâ€™s platform. And theyâ€™re off to a great start. The leadership team includes experienced operators from insurance and high growth technology companies. Seyna raised â‚¬47 million total investment from Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Elaia, Allianz and La FinanciÃ¨re Saint James â€“ including a record â‚¬33 million Series A in December 2021. Since its launch in 2019, when Seyna acquired an insurance company license, the platform has enabled over 100 insurance brokers who use Seyna to protect over 1 million policyholders. They have a very ambitious mission with tough problems to work on. Itâ€™ll only be possible if we have the best team. Join us !
secteur_activite: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning, Insurance, FinTech / InsurTech

intitule: Data BI Analyst M/F Permanent contract
description: As a Data Business Intelligence Analyst, you will assume a pivotal role within the ORIS organization, utilizing  data, business intelligence best practices and tools  to generate valuable insights and facilitate  well-informed decision-making . Your responsibilities will cover the  entire BI process , including data loading and processing, the development of key performance indicators, and the creation of dashboards. Youâ€™ll collaborate with diverse teams to define project scopes and implement solutions, all while using  agile principles and the kanban framework . This is a permanent position located in ORIS, with offices conveniently situated near Lyonâ€™s Part Dieu train station, and a fantastic multicultural team to work alongside! List of activities :  Data Collection, cleaning and transformation Gather data from various sources, such as databases, APIs, or web scraping. Organize and manage datasets in a datalake. Clean and preprocess data to ensure its accuracy and consistency, including handling missing values and outliers. Transform and aggregate data, create data models to support reporting and analysis. Data Analysis and governance Explore the datasets and identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Ensure data quality, privacy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders based on data analysis. Data Visualization and reporting Define and track Key Performance Indicators to assess the performance of various business processes and departments. Design and develop dashboards, reports and visualizations, providing data insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Prepare business oriented datasets for ad-hoc analysis. Publish reports to internal and external customers, embed the reports in our SaaS platform, and manage user permissions Project Management and stakeholder collaboration Collaborate with various stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements. Scope, plan, and execute BI projects to meet deadlines and objectives. Train business users and colleagues to effectively use BI solutions. Strategic Guidance and continuous improvement Contribute to the definition and execution of the organizationâ€™s data strategy and roadmap Stay updated on the latest business intelligence methodologies, tools and technologies. Promote the use of indicators and a data-driven culture.
secteur_activite: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning, SaaS / Cloud Services, Building / Public Works

description: Data Analysis & Strategic Insights : Dive deep into complex data sets representing shopper behavior to extract actionable insights. Your analyses will inform strategic decisions, helping to refine product features, improve unit economics, and guide the development of future product roadmaps. CRM & Buyer Journey Optimization : Oversee the management of customer relationships, with a focus on enhancing the buyer journey. Utilize data-driven strategies to increase engagement, improve retention, and drive sales on the platform. Cross-functional Data Collaboration : Work closely with various departments, including marketing, product development, and sales, to provide data-driven insights. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that decisions across the company are informed by robust, analytical insights. Operational Data Management : Monitor key business metrics and manage the operational aspects of data analysis and CRM. Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports to enhance company-wide understanding of key metrics and shopper experiences. Marketplace Insights & Innovation : Actively contribute to the evolution of the platform by using data insights to identify new opportunities for marketplace expansion and innovation. Your role will involve spotting trends, predicting future market demands, and proposing strategies to attract and retain users, reinforcing Jamble's position as a leader in the sustainable fashion marketplace. Project Management & Execution : Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. Ensure that data analysis and CRM strategies are executed effectively, aligning with Jamble's broader goals and contributing to the platform's success. Profile At least 2-4 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Science role BA/B.Sc in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or other quantitative fields Strong Excel skills Advanced knowledge of statistical tools and models is an advantage At least two years of analytical work experience, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the e-commerce industry Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets Experience working with Amplitude High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations Fluent in French, High proficiency in English Benefits Lunch vouchers (Swile) Healthcare (Alan) Desk at Voodooâ€™s office (awarded Best Office Space in Paris)

description: â­ About the team: Made up of six subteams (Dashboard, Engine, Infrastructure, Integrations, Threat Research & Security), the DataDome tech team is spread across Europe and the US. We handle over 2 000 billion events per day giving responses within 3ms (99p). We are present in more than 25 data centers around the world, deployed using Docker. We deploy on AWS, Scaleway, Vultr, and GCP, using Docker, Ansible and Terraform, and monitor with Grafana and Prometheus. We handle an average of  8 billion requests per day and manage more than 300 TB of data per month. When it comes to our stack, we run real-time detection layer in Java, low latency Stream Engine running on Flink in Scala, ElasticSearch for storage, Kafka for communication between layers, HAProxy for load balancing, Symfony & Angular for our dashboards. We use Slack, GitHub, Hangouts, & StackOverflow for Teams. While previous experience in cyber is not a must, we'll pair you with mentors who will help you bridge the gaps. As #growth is part of our DNA, weâ€™ll give you the resources and support you need to develop mastery. We are looking for a Cyber Security Analyst w/m who will be in charge of analyzing the bot traffic collected by our detection platform, creating dedicated data visualizations, helping our customers to decide how to act when they are encounter bot attacks. You will be more specifically in charge of: Be part of our threat research team, collaborate with threat researches and data scientists to challenge our detection engine on a daily basis Analyzing huge web traffic data sets (across more than 100 billions documents) to identify and block malicious traffic Creating automates/scripts to detect outliers in our global traffic Contributing to support by analyzing past attacks to strenghten our detection! Identifying potential attacks and add new alerts to our detection platform ğŸ‘¤  What we look for: Bachelors Degree Required in a relevant field Have a previous experience in (web) cyber security Have a real passion for data and automated attacks mitigation Have expertise on Network or Web infrastructure Bonus points You implement bots during your spare time You have already used Kibana You have worked with DBs like ElasticSearch Whatâ€™s in it for you? Flex Life:  Flexible remote, hybrid or in office options, including working from our Paris office, located next to the Opera Garnier + 500â‚¬ stipend to help you set up your ideal workspace. Generous Health Benefits:  Leading healthcare providers for each EU country (e.g. Alan in France). Professional Development : #Growth is part of our DNA, therefore we provide an annual stipend to invest in yourself. Events & Teambuilding:  Feel the #TeamSpirit both virtually & onsite, with several events & workshops planned throughout the year, including two annual offsite events, summer & winter parties, lunch & learns, & much more. Perks:  we prefer to adapt to what works best for you. Some prefer lunch on us, others prefer sports with friends, therefore we believe BotBusters should decide what works best for them. Parent Care:  Gift & care packages for parents. PTO:  Based on the country you are based from (e.g. 25 days in France). What are the next steps? Talent Acquisition Manager will contact you for a first chat You will then meet with CÃ©line You will complete  case study The final step will be a one-on-one meeting with Gilles our CTO Welcome to DataDome! ğŸ¦„ DataDomeâ€™s bot and online fraud protection detects and mitigates attacks with unparalleled accuracy and zero compromise. Our machine learning solution analyzes 3 trillion signals per day to adapt to new threats in real time. Hundreds of enterprises worldwideâ€”including Reddit, Patreon, and AngelListâ€”trust DataDomeâ€™s solution and 24/7 SOC experts to protect their mobile apps, websites, and APIs against online fraud, ATO, carding, scraping, layer 7 DDoS, credential stuffing, and more. A force multiplier for IT and security teams, DataDome is fully transparent, easy to deploy, and frictionless for consumers. We offer the only secure, user-friendly, and privacy compliant CAPTCHA integrated with our complete 360Â° bot detection solution. With 25+ regional PoPs and autoscaling technology, DataDome responds to requests with zero latency and no impact on the speed of protected platforms. In 2022, DataDome was ranked the top  G2 Leader in Bot Detection & Mitigation , named a Strong Performer in the  Forrester Wave: Bot Management , and placed 21st in cybersecurity on the Inc. 5000. Certified a Great Place to Work in the US and France, DataDomeâ€™s dedicated team of BotBusters spans the globe as far as its high-profile customer base. DataDome is an equal opportunity employer, and proud to be committed to diversity and inclusion. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age.
description_entreprise: DataDome is a global cybersecurity company specializing in protection against online fraud and advanced cyberattacks. Their mission is to free the web from fraudulent traffic. Their experts use artificial intelligence-based technology to detect and block the most sophisticated â€œbad botsâ€ in real time. Using their innovative products and solutions, Datadome is changing the standard for online fraud protection: proudly protecting over 250 companies worldwide, including TripAdvisor, The New York Times, Foot Locker, Patreon, Carrefour, BlaBlaCar, ZocDoc, Veepee and Reddit. The company is fully remote-enabled, allowing the 160 â€œBotBustersâ€ spread around the world (and they are actively recruiting!) to collectively protect their customers from malicious traffic.

description: Weâ€™re on a mission to help organizations contextualize the environment they operate in. At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe. What do we do? We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.  Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, and financial services. Who are we looking for? We are looking for a Data Analyst to be in charge of all the data deliveries (data extraction or data analysis)  from our Data Lake to our customers. To be successful as a Data Analyst, you should have prior data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring data visionary. You also need to have business or client experience. The opportunity Our stack runs on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Pub/Sub, Dataflow..), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), modern deployment (Terraform), and management platforms (GCP). You will manage all the data extraction in coordination with the product and  customer success team.  This is a unique opportunity to be part of a highly promising  start-up in its early stage and play a vital role in establishing and expanding its market. Your Role at Echo Weâ€™re currently scaling the team and hiring talents to grow faster. You will be responsible to : Understand the product / customers requirements and specify the strategy to extract the data Provide visibility on the deliveries to the business. Ability to lead an end-to-end project. Ability to work in a big data environment, different platforms and technologies. Provide data analysis to obtain the requested data (raw visit, dwell time, cross visitation...) using data sciences such as normalization, extrapolationâ€¦ Write complex and efficient SQL queries to transform raw data points from our data lake into reliable business use cases. Ensure data is clean, consistent and accurate. Be a technical guide to various business entities and data marts. Train data users on SQL and analytics best practices. Create clear and easy to understand technical documents that explain fully the datasets created. Continue learning new skills thanks to the Echo Analytics knowledge plan Resolve complex problems coming from the data.  Ability to communicate and work with cross-functional (both R&D and Commercial) teams.  What weâ€™re looking for: Fluency in English (French is a plus) At least 2 years of experience in Big Data, Data warehousing in tier-1 software companies. 2+ years of experience in Data Analysis in Python/SQL/R. An experience in Data Visualization in Python or other BI tools. An experience in project management is a plus. Strong organizational skills. Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack. Strong experience in Agile Methods (Lean is a plus). Working knowledge in DevOps: GitHub CI/CD, Terraform, Notion, Jira or other Project Management tools. What we offer: The opportunity to join an early stage fast-growing start-up and to scale with us A great international team based in Paris A contemporary office space in the center of Paris (Wework, place de Clichy, Paris 09) Remote-friendly policy Free coffee and snacks Weekly team lunch Healthcare: Alan  An amazing and supporting work environment focused on your professional growth and development Hiring process: 1/ Screening with RaphaÃ«lle, Talent Acquisition Manager  2/ Technical interview with Angela 3/ Technical Test : logical game (live) with a DE + Angela  4/ Cultural fit Delivery team + 1 sales
description_entreprise:
Founded in 2021, Echoâ€™s narrative is one of relentless growth, ambition, and promise.  A cutting-edge startup at the forefront of Geospatial Data and Gen AI technologies, they have skyrocketed from 0 to 50+ employees in just two years! Specialists in the location intelligence industry, Echo Analytics empowers innovation by helping companies better understand the world around them. What makes them tick? In a world inundated with data, quality is crucial. Echo uses data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build Europeâ€™s most comprehensive, high-quality datasets, enriched with differentiating attributes that outmaneuver the competition. They partner with a spectrum of industries, from retail and mobility to smart cities, real estate, advertising, market research, and financial services. At Echo, the possibilities are truly endless. They arenâ€™t just about reliable data  (read: unmatched quality) though. Life at Echo is about individual growth, collective ambition, and a culture that values and celebrates diversity. With a â€œpeople firstâ€ philosophy guiding everything they do.
 Youâ€™ll be at the heart of innovation, tackling projects that shape our future, with the best people possible! ğŸ˜

description: In 2024, Swan anticipates significant revenue growth, primarily driven by the expansion of existing partners. The optimization of our end-user funnel, specifically focusing on Onboarding & Usage, is crucial. The data team will collaborate closely with different teams (Technical Account Manager, Account Managers, and Customer Success Managers) to provide insights and recommendations to partners on workflow optimization. Additionally, collaboration with the Product team is essential for recommending optimizations to our product. âœ¨  Your mission As a Product Data Analyst at Swan, your mission is to be a product expert within the data team, focusing on Swanâ€™s product and use cases. Write actionable insights and recommendations, presenting findings to key stakeholders (top management, clients, Account Executives, Product Managers). Build reusable data marts and dashboards. Perform deep dive analysis of each part of our usersâ€™ funnel, delivering actionable insights and recommendations that directly impact Swanâ€™s client growth. Actively participate in day-to-day data operations, including generating and maintaining weekly/monthly reports, identifying and addressing data quality issues, answering ad-hoc questions, and prioritizing data requests. âœ¨  Your team Reporting to Romain, our VP of Data, you will join our new Data team, which includes Antoine, our Data Engineer, Yujun, our Data Analyst, and Alexandre, our Data Analytics Engineer. description: At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. More than 40% of all food produced in the world is wasted and retailers lose between 1-3% of their annual sales due to food waste, all of this waste has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.  The Retail Technologies teams at Too Good To Go are working on our new software solution, the Too Good To Go Platform, used directly by Retailers to track and redistribute surplus food seamlessly. This B2B app, connected to our consumer marketplace, helps stores better manage expiry dates by; detecting products that are about to expire, recommending what to do with them, and facilitating their redistribution (via discounting for in-store customers, donations to charities, or sales on the marketplace). This business app is already used by tens of thousands of store employees every day, and soon to be hundreds of thousands by the end of the year in several countries.  Weâ€™re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste. Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of 80 million registered users and 197,000 active partners across 17 countries, have together already prevented 266+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 665,000 tonnes of CO2e! The Role As a Senior Product Analyst in the Retail Tech Product team, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Retailer Partners and to our business. You will analyse various types of data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.  In particular, you will have to: Partner with Product Managers to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis. Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments

From the bottom of the oceans to the depths of space and cyberspace, we help our customers think smarter and act faster - mastering ever greater complexity and every decisive moment along the way. Whatever it takes.

description: About BlaBlaCar BlaBlaCar is the worldâ€™s leading community-based travel app enabling 26 million members a year to carpool or travel by bus in 21 countries. Our team of 700+ employees counts over 50 nationalities and is spread across our 6 global offices, 30% working fully remotely. Your Mission We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Bus & Train team at BlaBlaCar. The companyâ€™s mission is to make BlaBlaCar the go-to marketplace for shared road travel (hence excluding airlines). To achieve this mission, we are currently developing other supplies than our historic carpool activity: we operate a marketplace of bus carriers in Brazil and Eastern Europe, and we are soon going to sell train tickets from several European train operators. The Data Bus & Train team, part of the central Data team, connects the data from those two supplies. We build dashboards and algorithms to optimise the operations, evaluate the demand and provide key actionable insights for the business teams. By joining BlaBlaCar as a Data Analyst, youâ€™ll make an impact on two majors growth levers for the company (Buses and trains) using data and find yourself at the crossroads of many expertises.  Through your projects, you will be working closely with Data Engineers and Data Scientists. The services are now organised following Data Mesh principles, distributing data ownership to domain-specific teams that manage, own, and serve the data as a product. At the same time, youâ€™ll join a well-rounded and experienced Data team working on a modern stack and youâ€™ll belong to a larger internal community of 25+ analysts. Your Responsibilities As a Data Analyst working on the Data Bus & Trains team, you will be responsible for: â€¢ Infusing a data-informed mindset to business decision makers by working conjointly with the Business team to define, analyse and report on Business KPIs  â€¢ Providing actionable insights by investigation and exploratory analytics â€¢ Owning the Data Mart layer in a multidisciplinary team, working closely with your teammates from different data backgrounds: data scientists, data engineers, software engineers â€¢ Building, improving, and maintaining a suite of Tableau dashboards and supporting data consumers to get autonomous in their usage of data â€¢ Crafting scalable reports by developing clean, reproducible, well-documented, and version-controlled code Your Qualifications â€¢ 2+ years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst â€¢ Advanced SQL â€¢ Knowledge in applied statistics â€¢ Proficiency in one data visualisation tool (we mostly use Tableau) â€¢ Experience in synthesising and communicating data clearly â€¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills ; ability to think strategically â€¢ You have excellent communication skills and enjoy sharing and learning from others â€¢ You are organised, results-driven, and are able to prioritise in a changing environment â€¢ Fluency in English  If you donâ€™t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why youâ€™d still be a great fit for this role in your application! What we have to offer: â€¢ Full remote possible in the country of employment â€¢ 4 additional weeks parental leave 100% paid â€¢ Financial support for home office equipment â€¢ 25 days holiday per year + RTT â€¢ Local meal plan policies (Swile card in France) â€¢ 50% transportation paid in France (Forfait MobilitÃ© Durable) â€¢ Relocation package and visa support â€¢ Free unlimited carpooling & bus rides â€¢ Personal growth via trainings, mentorship, and internal mobility programs â€¢ Employee Stock Ownership plan â€¢ Regular team building events â€¢ Mental health support through  Moka.care Interested in joining the ride? Hereâ€™s what your hiring journey will look like: â€¢ a 20 min online quiz, to assess your analytics skills â€¢ a 45-min video-call with  Benjamin , Talent Acquisition Manager, to get to know you, understand your career expectations and answer your questions â€¢ a 45 min video-call with your future manager  Hugo  to evaluate your communication and teamwork skills, followed by a 30 min live business case â€¢ a home assignment to evaluate your technical skills, followed by a 90-min video-call with your future colleague Natalia and another Data analyst from the Analytics Chapter â€¢ a 30-min video-call with  Emmanuel Martin-Chave , VP DataUsually, our hiring process lasts 20-25 days and offers come within 48 hours. Not sure yet?  Check out our  100 reasons to join BlaBlaCar ! BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
description_entreprise: BlaBlaCar is the worldâ€™s leading community-based travel app enabling 26 million active members a year to share a ride in 21 countries. Its technology matches drivers with empty seats with passengers heading the same way, so they can share the cost of the trip. With the mission to be the go-to marketplace for shared travel, BlaBlaCar combines carpooling with bus journeys from over 4000 operators to offer a wide choice of affordable and sustainable travel solutions, all in one app. In 2022, BlaBlaCarâ€™s trusted community connected 2 million meeting points worldwide and enabled 90 million human encounters. Carpool drivers saved 450 million euros, and all BlaBlaCarâ€™s mobility services contributed to avoiding 1.5 million tonnes of CO2 emissions.

description: Context: We are looking for Data Asset Owners (DAOs), the Product Owners of data assets accountable for the delivery, relevancy, and accessibility of their data assets.  DAO prioritizes and manages the development of its data assets. He works with Data management team, consumers of this data, the delivery team, the run team, the security team, etc â€¦. to ensure that data assets get built efficiently and meet user needs. He also manages the setup of features such as observability and SLOs once defined with the stakeholders. DAO is the key point of contact for any request throughout the data asset lifecycle. He qualifies demands (initial need, new features, â€¦) and defines functional requirements to help technical teams fulfill business needs. He is also accountable for data asset remediations where he ensures the proper resolution of incidents by soliciting relevant stakeholders (run team, D&A platform team, Data Governor, etc â€¦). He manages accesses and defines sharing policies of the data asset. description: JOIN DECATHLONâ€™S ANALYTICS FACTORY  The BU Data in Decathlon has the mission to accelerate data usage and commercialization, leading the ambitious Digital revolution in Decathlon Group. At the heart of the BU data, the Analytics Factory teams work closely with the product & business teams to scale up data usage at Decathlon. Our team has a key impact in providing product & business teams with insights and accelerating Decathlonâ€™s digital transformation in over 60 countries.  The Analytics teams are composed of about 40 people in 4 main domains: Sport & Process, Supply Chain, Digital Products and Customer-User Experience.  We are hiring a senior Data Analyst in Customer Growth scope based in Paris, Lille, or Amsterdam. He/she will  be part of an exciting and growing international journey together with Decathlon. RESPONSIBILITIES   Build scalable analytic frameworks to generate insights for Decathlonâ€™s Customer and Marketing Ecosystem such as Identity, Campaign Incrementality, Loyalty Program, Lookalike Marketing.   Design, drive and analyze results of experiments such as A/B tests and Causal Inferences.  Partner with key stakeholders such as Product Managers, Business Managers, Engineers and Data Managers to be able to qualify their needs and translate them into relevant data analysis.   Drive analytics studies to improve Decathlonâ€™s understanding of customer behaviors and potential growth strategy such as Churn, CLTV, Segment, Affinity, Relevancy.  Identify and quantify opportunities for new business and product development; Turn business and product problems into actionable insights.   Mentor junior data analysts and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.  SKILLS YOU'LL NEED    5 years of relevant industry experience working in large scale plateforme or B2C Digital marketing environment   Background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Data Science.   Experience designing A/B tests.   You speak fluent English and French is a bonus.   Strong knowledge of SQL, Python and statistics is a must ; advanced analytical and machine learning knowledge is preferred.   You want to join a company with a positive impact (#Tech4Good)  NICE TO HAVE   Experience with the causal inference is a plus  Experience in User Growth/Growth Hacker is a plus  DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT  What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. Driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction, we constantly innovate to develop cutting-edge tools and services that set new standards in the market. Get in touch if you are looking to join a purpose-driven, international team that revolutionizes an old-fashioned industry! Together  Letâ€™s Rewild Retail !  The Team : We are looking for Ankorstore future  Senior Data Analyst specialized in Logistics .  As a key member of our central data analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging our data as a significant asset to achieve our only mission: making our retailers and brands thrive. You will hold a cross-functional role that bridges our data engineers and our business teams.Working closely with the logistic team youâ€™ll have a unique opportunity to have a meaningful impact on our customers and to get a 360 view on the e-commerce BtoB supply chain (transportation, fulfillment, cross-border shipping). Main responsibilities :  Help us refine and implement our vision of a data driven company Bring your expertise to provide game-changing and actionable business insights through data Transform complex business problematics into clear data driven solutions with actionable business outcomes Strong involvement in the development of the logistics data architecture : Maintain a high standard on data quality by owning data processes, layers of the data warehouse and best practices Leverage data to support operational processes, in-depth research of defects trends and daily operational monitoring  Build the products that will empower our teams to monitor their key performance indicators and drive accountability Help and train our business analysts to understand our data and use our tools Requirements :  At least 2+ years of experience as an analyst in a tech startup, in a global corporation or in a consulting firm Analytical skills  - You like to answer complex business questions through data. You are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it Technical skills  - You are proficient in SQL and have experience with Git & GitHub Attention to detail & curiosity  - You do not let important details slip through the cracks! You like to dig into 'strange' trends and find the story behind them Creativity & proactivity  - You can find creative and simple solutions to tricky problems, using new approaches, tools and/or testing new ways of leveraging data Team player  - You always demonstrate a 'can-do' attitude and want to work in a team You are  humble  and like to make others succeed English  fluent Other skills that would add value: You come from a top tier Business or Engineering school You have experience using Python working on a Data Science project You have already used DBT You have experience in the retail industry Benefits/Perks  : At Ankorstore we offer a versatile range of benefits to support employees' well-being and work-life balance, fostering personal growth within an innovative and adaptable work environment. We are a remote-friendly company; depending on your role, you will have a full remote or a hybrid contract.  Remote friendly from Paris on this position . All of our employees are automatically covered by Health Insurance & Life Insurance. Our Health Insurance (Mutuelle) and Life Insurance (PrÃ©voyance) are Alan We have partnered with Swile to provide you with meal vouchers You will have access to  Leeto  a platform that provides you with exclusive discounts, cultural activities, holiday vouchers and more Enjoy health benefits through Class Pass, offering you the flexibility to attend in-person classes, digital sessions, or wellness workshops, keeping you active and engaged 25 days of paid leave +  10  RTT +/- 50% of the annual/monthly/weekly ticket for public transportation Modern  WeWork offices  located in the Opera neighbourhood in Paris, providing a vibrant and inspiring work environment 360Learning , a dynamic learning platform offering engaging, customized training experiences and fostering skills development across the entire organization PS : Due to the end of year period, do not expect an answer on your application before January 2024. Ankorstore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We donâ€™t discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

As a result, wild independents can thrive.

description: Goodays (formerly Critizr) is Europe's leading Customer Experience Management Platform. Founded in 2012, Our vision is to make commerce better for everyone - for merchants and customers. We want to help everyone deliver more human and personal customer experiences every day. Our mission is to bring your entire company together around a single goal: the customer. We provide a highly adopted Customer Experience Management platform that makes it easier to deliver more human and personal customer experiences at scale.. Our technology is used in 25 countries by over 150 of Europe's biggest companies, including Carrefour, Domino's, Credit Agricole, New Look, Leroy Merlin and Jules. We are present in more than 70,000 business locations and give the entire organisation, from C-suite to frontline, CX and insights teams the tools they need to bring value to the company and the customer. We are looking for a Data Analyst in the Customer Success Team to help us improve our business understanding and take the right decisions with our increasing amount of data. We will count on your technical expertise and business acumen to support the CS organization scale and provide qualitative analysis and deliverables. Goodays has already positioned itself as a leader in our industry, having experienced strong exponential growth for the past several years. Weâ€™re counting on you to help us attain even greater heights. Client Success is at the heart of everything we do! Our team of Engagement Managers, Adoption Digital Consultant, Retail Expert, Support Agents, and Customer Success Managers are dedicated to ensuring that our customers have the best possible experience in their journey with Goodays and achieve their business goals. This journey starts with the Customer Success team working closely with the client to set up, onboard, coach, and train on the Goodays solution, and along the way, the Customer Success team builds and maintains a long-term trusted relationship to bring the customer CX program to life and get the most out of Goodays solution via best practices, recommendations, benchmarks, and coaching. In this role, your main responsibilities are: Addressing Challenges for Goodays Clients Understand the role of Customer Success teams and their daily challenges in improving the platform usage for their clients. Comprehend the challenges faced by retail clients regarding the customer experience. Work-based on business briefs provided by the Customer Success team for internal or client needs. Assist teams in interpreting results and disseminating them to clients. Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities. Collaborating with Data and Product Teams Possess an in-depth understanding of the company's data ecosystem and architecture, along with its technical constraints. Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing quality control procedures in compliance with regulations (GDPR). Collaborate with Data and Product teams to understand and improve processes and usage. Management and Evolutionary Maintenance of Reports Work on standard reports on platform usage to showcase it to clients and provide readily usable visualizations for the Customer Success team on a daily basis. Proactively maintain a repository of reports and ensure the integrity and freshness of data for teams. Methods and Processes Document the production of deliverables. Systematically consider scaling or optimizing productions to serve the greatest number. Be proactive in suggesting ideas for data-related projects and be able to execute projects to successful completion. Desired Education & Experience Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field is a plus. Ability to effectively communicate analysis results to non-technical stakeholders. You have 3 years of minimum experience in a similar role You have a knack for understanding and abstracting business and product data You enjoy deep dive in the Data and extract insights (Data Mining)  You are familiar with relational database concepts You have a passion for data and youâ€™re eager to work in a SaaS environment Knowledge/sensibility about retail would be nice to have You will have to work with the following tools, and prior experience with them is nice to have: Metabase Google Looker Studio  Amplitude Any BI or Data viz tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Thoughtspot etc. Other requirements Fluent proficiency in both French and English Creative and innovative mindset Independent and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment) Naturally curious and always striving to learn new things Motivated team player with excellent interpersonal skills Flexibility and understanding of the culture of a fast-paced, commercially oriented technology company. Highly responsive and service-oriented attitude, accustomed to working in an international environment, action-driven Ability to maintain strong working relationships Passion for making a difference, interested in our ability to have a social impact in the world of retail. Problem-Solving Reporting Line Reporting directly to the to the Customer Success Ops Lead What Goodays offers you A front-row seat with a company that is changing the way multiple industries do business, thanks to a best-in-class product and exponential growth A great and diverse team of professionals who are talented, fun, supportive, open, communicative, and who you can learn from and share with Fun and challenging working environment with significant opportunities for career growth and development  An international environment Attractive salary package including excellent pension, health insurance and life insurance Open and inclusive working environment including flexible hours and parent-friendly options
description_entreprise: Goodays is one of the fastest-growing, most exciting tech start-ups operating today. We have offices in London, Paris and Lille, and backing from some of the worldâ€™s best venture capital firms. We have clients in more than 30 countries. Goodays provides a SaaS solution which enables retailers and brands to put the customer at the heart of their business, starting from their local teams. Today, thousands of retail professionals use Goodays to understand and engage in conversations with their local customers across all channels. Our primary investors, including 83North, have an impressive track record of investment including companies like Airbnb, DropBox, Zendesk, LinkedIn, Mirakl, JustEat, Facebook. We currently employ over 80 people, and our team has been doubling year over year.
